str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To aid, relieve, do service, render help, be strong enough for. From epi and arkeo; to avail for, i.e. Help.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To weight, load, burden, lit. and met. From barus; to weigh down.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To aid, relieve, do service, render help, be strong enough for. From epi and arkeo; to avail for, i.e. Help.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.
Really, truly, actually. Adverb of the oblique cases of on; really.
